comments.html: With more uplinks less buffer so lower latency.
comments.name: Donce

comments.html:
Part (possibly all) of the story is the number of MACs on the chip. A chip that has 128 lanes might only have 104 MACs, so you will never have more than 104 front panel ports.

I don't recall multiple Trident2 SKUs, but Trident/Trident+ had a L2-only SKU. Same die, of course, just with the L3 functionality fused off before packaging.
comments.name: Nolan
